resources.string: Visit facebook.com/device on your smartphone or computer and enter this code
Unexpected error while downloading an image.
New! You\'re in control - choose what info you want to share with apps.
%1$s won\'t work unless you enable Google Play services.
%1$s won\'t run without Google Play services, which are missing from your phone.
%1$s won\'t run without Google Play services, which are missing from your tablet.
%1$s is having trouble with Google Play services. If the problem persists, please contact the developer for assistance.
%1$s relies on Google Play services, which is not supported by your device. Contact the manufacturer for assistance.
%1$s won\'t run unless you update Google Play services.
%1$s won\'t run without Google Play services, which are currently updating.
New version of Google Play services needed. It will update itself shortly.
Unable to load message. Please try again later.
Please verify your truck’s odometer value before driving with DashLink.
Please connect to a DashLink before driving.
You are driving a DashLink equipped truck, so use of the driving status is automatic based on vehicle motion.
You are driving a DashLink equipped truck, so use of the off duty driving status is automatic based on vehicle motion.

The truck you are driving requires a newer version of the DashLink device than you are using. Please contact your fleet manager regarding obtaining the correct version of DashLink. In the meantime, you must switch to paper driver logs.
DashLink is incompatible with this truck. Please contact your fleet manager to disable DashLink. In the meantime, you must switch to paper driver logs.
You have installed a different DashLink device in your engine than the last one detected for this truck. Your odometer requires recalibration before you can continue driving.
DashLink disconnected while driving. Please check your DashLink device at the next opportunity. In the meantime, you must switch to paper driver logs.
Automatically change duty status when on duty
This log has not yet been certified.
Enter your BigRoad password to change your email address:
The email address “%s” is not valid. Please correct it and try again.
Check that you entered it correctly.
Check that you entered it correctly.
Check that you entered your new password correctly.
Your new password must be at least %d characters long.
Your home time zone determines when your day begins and ends. It should be the same as the time zone where your fleet’s head office is.
If you are dispatched out of a location in a different time zone, set it here.
Please add at least one email address to send your location.
Trying to determine your check in location
(Looking for GPS or a network connection)
Please wait for a location to be determined before checking in.
Would you like to ignore the rest of the unassigned driving time?\n\nYou can claim it later by editing your logs while connected to DashLink.
This is an unassigned driving event. If you were driving at this time, claim it as yours.
You were already driving at this time. You cannot claim this driving event.
The date and time on this device appear to be set correctly. The current setting is:
The expected current date and time is:
Choose “Fix Date/Time” below to go to the date settings screen, where you can check if the date and time are set correctly.
The date or time on this device may be set incorrectly. The current setting is:
Duty status conflict: could not modify logs
Sensor failure: missing road speed data
Sensor failure: wrong version of DashLink

Your password is too simple or is a common password. It must:
- Be at least 6 characters long
- Contain at least one alphabetic character
- Contain at least one numeric character
Please enter a password for your account.
Your passwords don’t match: please re-enter them, making sure you type the same password in both password fields.
We have detected a power cycle (engine turned off and then turned back on). Do you want to continue Personal Conveyance, or change your duty status to Off Duty?
We have detected a power cycle (engine turned off and then turned back on). Do you want to continue Yard Move, or change your duty status to On Duty?
We have detected your vehicle has been stopped for five minutes. Do you want to continue driving, or change your duty status to On Duty?
Tap the “New Chat” button to send messages to other BigRoad users.
You can also tap “Documents” to send pictures or documents, or tap “Check In” to email your location to someone.
You can use the messaging feature to chat with other members of your fleet. To get started, create an account and tell us a bit about your fleet.
You can use the messaging feature to chat with other members of your fleet. To get started, tell us a bit about your fleet.
Enter your message and tap “Send” to start a chat.
Enter your message and tap “Send” to start a chat with %s.
You have edit suggestions from %s for this day.
This is a newly created event.
Your account has been created with the given email address and password.
The email address %s is already being used for BigRoad access. If it belongs to you, use it to sign in to the app.
To create an account please\nenter your email and password.
The date and time settings of this device do not match the current time.
Set Duty Status with a Note
I, %s, certify that any log entries I entered are true and correct.
I declare that all vehicles have been inspected in accordance with the applicable requirements.
I, %s, certify that any log entries I entered are true and correct.
I, %s, hereby certify that my data entries and my record of duty status for this 24-hour period are true and correct.
I, %s, certify this log is true and correct.
This inspection has already been signed. If you change it you will have to sign the inspection again when all changes are complete.
This inspection has already been signed. If you add a new inspection to the report you will have to sign the report again when you are finished.
I, %s, hereby certify that my data entries and my record of duty status for this 24-hour period are true and correct.
I, %s, certify this log is true and correct.
You must enter driver, vehicle, fleet or shipping information for this log before signing it.
To sign your log you must enter your name and email address.
You must provide a handwritten signature to sign the log with.
This inspection report still needs to be signed.
This log has not been signed. Do you want to sign it before sending?
Signature not available; please ensure you have a working internet connection.
This inspection report still has validation warnings. Do you want to sign it?
This log still has validation warnings. Do you want to sign it?
Time zone can’t be edited when using DashLink-equipped trucks. You may have a supervisor edit the time zone after you sign this log.
Do you want to delete this odometer entry from your daily log?
After saving this information you will be taken to the next item with warnings.
DashLink will record driving distance automatically.
Shipping document numbers are required, or
Total distance can’t be edited when recorded by DashLink.
Driving time that is automatically recorded by DashLink can’t be edited.
This change is not allowed because it affects an AOBRD log that has already been signed. A signed AOBRD log can be edited by a supervisor.
Driving time is automatically recorded by DashLink and can’t be edited.
This change is not allowed because it affects a log that has a pending carrier edit. You should speak with your safety manager to resolve these days’ logs.
Are you sure you want to delete this event?
After saving or deleting this event you will be taken to the next item with warnings.
This change affects some logs that have already been signed. If you save this change you will have to sign those logs again.
Deleting this event affects some logs that have already been signed. If you delete this event you will have to sign those logs again.
The requested logs could not be faxed.
You are faxing %1$d driver logs from %2$s through %3$s.
This feature requires a working internet connection.
You are faxing your driver log for %s.
You are faxing your driver log and vehicle inspections for %s.
BigRoad can print your logs to a fax machine for inspection.
A fax request has been sent. It can take several minutes for the fax to arrive.
There was a problem sending the fax. Please make sure your phone has a working network connection and try again.
An error was encountered while trying to send the fax.
This summary information is only accurate up until the time of the device malfunction.
Your log cannot be successfully submitted at this time. You may have to select a different inspection method.
Your log has been sent and received by FMCSA
There was a problem sending the information. Please make sure your phone has a working network connection and try again.
This device complies with all requirements for automatic on-board recording devices in the United States and Canada.
This DashLink device is a §395.15 compliant AOBRD that is connected to the engine and automatically records drive time.
This DashLink device is a §395.15 compliant AOBRD that is currently malfunctioning.
Although the AOBRD is malfunctioning, you can inspect the logs prior to the malfunction.

Swipe your finger up and down on any screen to view the complete details.

This device is an Electronic Recording Device as outlined in Section 83 of the Canadian federal hours of service regulations. It is connected to the engine and automatically records drive time.

Tap “Continue” at the bottom of the screen to see summary information and logs for each day.
This device is an Electronic Recording Device that is connected to the engine and automatically records drive time. It is currently malfunctioning and the driver should be using a paper logbook.

Swipe your finger up and down on any screen to view the complete details.

On May 12, 2014 the FMCSA provided guidance which clarified that a driver using an AOBRD is not required to provide printed, email or fax records of duty status to an enforcement official.

Tap “Continue” at the bottom of the screen to see the AOBRD summary information and logs prior to the malfunction.

Swipe your finger up and down on any screen to view the complete details.

This device stores electronic logs that are compliant with Sections 80 through 82 of the Canadian federal hours of service regulations. It is not connected to the engine, and stores logs that are equivalent to paper logs.

If a copy of the logs is required, the driver can email or fax them, or can print if a printer is available. The driver can create a handwritten copy if necessary.

Tap “Continue” at the bottom of the screen to see the logs for each day.
This DashLink device is a compliant Electronic Logging Device as defined in Federal Motor Carrier Safety regulation 49 CFR part 395 Subpart B.
This DashLink device is a compliant Electronic Logging Device as defined in Federal Motor Carrier Safety regulation 49 CFR part 395 Subpart B that is currently malfunctioning.
Although the ELD is malfunctioning, you can inspect the logs prior to the malfunction.

Tap “Show Header” to see the current header and hours summary.

Tap “Show Inspection Logs” to see the duty time for each day, unidentified driving recorded, and diagnostic/malfunction status.

Swipe your finger up and down on any screen to view the complete details. Use the back button on the device to return to this screen.

Tap “Header” to see the current header and hours summary.

Tap “Inspection Logs” to see the duty time for each day, unidentified driving recorded, and diagnostic/malfunction status.

Swipe your finger up and down on any screen to view the complete details. Use the back button on the device to return to this screen.

Tap “Show Hours Summary” to view the hours of service summary, or tap “Show Daily Logs” to see the duty time for each day. Use the back button on the device to return to this screen.\n\nSwipe your finger up and down on any screen to view the complete details.
You are about to start a DashLink inspection of your logs.
Show the enforcement official your driver card.
Tap “Inspect On-screen” and give your device to the enforcement official. They will view your logs and return the device when finished.
If requested, tap ”Send to FMCSA” to send your log to the FMCSA via Web Service or Email.
You can tap “Send/Print Logs” to email, fax or print your logs.
You are using DashLink to automatically record driving time, but the device is malfunctioning.
Show the enforcement official your driver card.
You should be using a paper logbook while the device is malfunctioning. Show the enforcement official your paper logbook.
Tap “Inspect On-screen” to view the logs recorded prior to the malfunction.
This summary information is only accurate up until the time of the device malfunction.
Time on duty for 7 day period
Time on duty for 8 day period

Use the arrow buttons at the top of the screen to view different days.

Swipe your finger up and down to view the complete log details.

You can also tilt the device on its side to change the size of the duty status graph.
Please give the device to the inspector.

Please give the device to the inspector.

To use inspection mode:

Use the arrow buttons at the top of the screen to view different days.

Swipe your finger up and down to view the complete log details.

You can also tilt the device on its side to change the size of the duty status graph.
Please return the device to the driver.
You are sharing %1$d driver logs from %2$s through %3$s.
You can send these logs to one or more email addresses. The recipients will receive %1$s.
There is no driver, vehicle, fleet or shipping information entered for this daily log. Would you like to complete the log before sending?
This log has not been signed. Would you like to sign the log before sending?
This log has not been signed. Do you still want to send it?
You are sharing your driver log for %s.
You are sharing your driver log and vehicle inspections for %s.
You can send this log to one or more email addresses. The recipients will receive %1$s.
an email with a printable PDF attached
an email with a link to the log and a printable PDF
This log still has validation warnings. Do you want to send it?
This log was edited by %1$s on %2$s.
Connection was lost while preparing the document.
Error occurred while preparing the document.
Your log has been saved to your downloads folder.
There are validation warnings for this inspection report. Would you like to fix the problems now?
There are validation warnings for this daily log. Would you like to fix the problems now?
This feature requires a working internet connection.
Printing requires a printing app to be installed.
If this is vehicle %s, tap Connect. Otherwise, tap Skip to keep searching.
1. Your DashLink device is plugged in firmly.\n2. Your vehicle is turned on.
No more DashLink devices found. Please make sure your vehicle is turned on and you are in the cab.
This DashLink device was unable to get the vehicle’s odometer. Please make sure your vehicle is turned on.
This DashLink device was unable to get the Vehicle Identification Number. Please make sure your vehicle is turned on.
No DashLink devices found. Please make sure your vehicle is turned on and you are in the cab.
Attempting to read the odometer from your truck, please make sure your vehicle is turned on.
Tap Skip to keep searching for other DashLink devices.
The Bluetooth radio on this mobile device is turned off. Bluetooth is required to connect to a DashLink device. To turn on Bluetooth, tap the button below.
This mobile device does not support Bluetooth wireless. Bluetooth is required to connect to a DashLink device.
Touch here to calibrate your odometer.
Please verify the odometer value of your truck.
The connection has been made, and DashLink may be ready to use soon.
Wait for DashLink GPS before driving…
Wait for odometer readings before driving…

The engine connection is missing road speed data. It is possible the speed sensor in the vehicle is broken and should be repaired. Please contact your fleet manager to disable DashLink for this truck. In the meantime, you must use paper driver logs.
Sensor failure: missing road speed data…
DashLink requires odometer readings in order to produce valid logs. If DashLink is not reading an odometer from the vehicle connection, you may need a new DashLink.
Sensor failure: driving without odometer readings…

The truck is not reporting road speed. It is possible the speed sensor in the vehicle is broken and should be repaired. Please contact your fleet manager to disable DashLink for this truck. In the meantime, you must use paper driver logs.
Sensor failure: truck not reporting road speed…

BigRoad detected a fast odometer. It is possible the odometer or speed sensor in the vehicle is broken and should be repaired. Please contact your fleet manager to disable DashLink for this truck. In the meantime, you must use paper driver logs.

BigRoad detected a slow odometer. It is possible the odometer or speed sensor in the vehicle is broken and should be repaired. Please contact your fleet manager to disable DashLink for this truck. In the meantime, you must use paper driver logs.
DashLink requires a verified odometer in order to produce valid logs.
Sensor failure: driving without a calibrated odometer…

This truck requires a newer version of the DashLink device than the one detected. Please contact your fleet manager regarding obtaining an appropriate DashLink. In the meantime, you must use paper driver logs.
Sensor failure: wrong version of DashLink…
Please make sure the vehicle is turned on, and you are in the cab of the vehicle. It may take several seconds to reconnect…
Could not connect to the DashLink device for truck number %s.
BigRoad detected vehicle movement, but DashLink was not connected at the time. Use paper logs until DashLink is connected again.

DashLink could not record a change in duty status because of a conflict with other recorded duty status changes on this day. You should switch to paper logs and contact your supervisor to correct the problem.
The Bluetooth radio on this mobile device is turned off. Bluetooth is required to connect to a DashLink device. Please open the Settings app and enable Bluetooth.
DashLink requires a new version of firmware to be installed before it can function correctly. It may take a minute or two to complete the update…
Please open the Settings app, choose General, Date & Time, and make sure your time, date and time zone settings are set correctly.
Attempting to determine DashLink firmware version. If this message persists for longer than a few minutes, please contact BigRoad Support at 1-888-305-8777.
The DashLink firmware configuration or version is not supported by this version of the app. Please contact BigRoad Support at 1-888-305-8777.
DashLink is updating. Please wait for the update to finish before driving. DashLink will reconnect automatically when the update is complete.
DashLink is unable to communicate with the engine’s ECM. Please check your DashLink cable and connections. If the issue persists, you will need to switch to paper logs and contact your fleet manager.
BigRoad detected vehicle movement, but DashLink was not connected at the time. If you are driving, switch to paper logs until DashLink is connected again.
A Jbus DashLink has been connected to an OBD2 vehicle. Please contact your fleet manager regarding obtaining the correct DashLink type. In the meantime, you must use paper driver logs.
To maintain a reliable DashLink connection, please keep this mobile device plugged into a charger.
Waiting for DashLink to acquire a GPS location fix. This may not be possible if the truck is in a tunnel or parking structure. In that case, please drive to an open area.
Vehicle number %s is not DashLink equipped. To set up this vehicle’s DashLink device, contact your fleet manager.
Vehicle number %s is not DashLink equipped.
To use DashLink, you must be a member of a BigRoad fleet. You can join an existing fleet or sign up for a free trial fleet account on the BigRoad website. A DashLink device is also required.
DashLink can’t read the odometer from your truck’s engine. Please ensure your engine is on. If your engine is already on, then please contact BigRoad Support at 1-888-305-8777.
To use DashLink, you must first select a vehicle equipped with a DashLink device.
Truck number %s doesn’t have a Vehicle Identification Number (VIN) on file yet. To set up this truck’s DashLink device, tap the button below.
To maintain a reliable DashLink connection, please keep this mobile device plugged into a charger.
An OBD2 DashLink has been connected to a Jbus vehicle. Please contact your fleet manager regarding obtaining the correct DashLink type. In the meantime, you must use paper driver logs.
To adjust odometer, please contact your administrator.
DashLink is a simple, affordable, and flexible way for you to achieve ELD mandate compliance. Automatically create logs, prevent form and manner errors, and stop violations.
The connection has been made, and DashLink should be ready to use in a few seconds.
Reconnecting to the DashLink device. Please make sure the vehicle is turned on, and you are in the cab of the vehicle. It may take several seconds to reconnect.
The wrong type of DashLink has been connected to this vehicle. Please contact your fleet manager regarding obtaining the correct DashLink type. In the meantime, you must use paper driver logs.
Quick access is provided to useful trucking apps.
Quick access is provided to useful tools such as route navigation or a calculator.
Quick access is provided to useful tools such as the phone or route navigation.
See your current daily log as well as your log history. You can also make changes to your logs.
DashLink will help you stay compliant with the ELD mandate, simplify your logging process and ensure that your logs are accurate up to the minute.
Tap the duty status button to keep track of your hours of service.
Your current GPS position is shown along with real-time traffic to help with route planning.
Chat with your dispatcher and other BigRoad users. You can also capture and send documents or send your current location to someone.
Send messages to someone. You can capture and send pictures & documents from your device or send your current location to someone.
Enter your current odometer reading. The odometer information will be added to your daily log.
If you sign in with a truck number then you can enter your odometer readings and they will be added to your daily log.
Thanks for choosing to drive with BigRoad!
Let’s take a quick tour of the BigRoad app to show you how it can help improve your life on the road.
The BigRoad app can help you stay connected, eliminate log errors & make more money.
Calculates vehicle axle weights quickly and easily.
Touch the Back button to return to BigRoad.
Helps you locate, map and navigate to the nearest Blue Beacon Truck Wash.
Access CAT Scale locations based on GPS location or custom search.
Shows nearby truck stops and travel plazas, diesel prices, Walmarts, rest stops and CAT Scales – as well as loads from the DAT Extended Network.
Detects the location of weigh stations and inspection sites, alerts you as they approach, and can offer bypass privileges to save time on the road and minimize unplanned stops.
GasBuddy helps you find the cheapest gas prices in the USA and Canada.
Makes it easy to eat healthy and reach your ideal weight by keeping track of what you eat.
Finds the nearest Love’s Travel Stop and Country Store based upon your location, city, state or zip code.
Helps you find your nearest Mack Trucks Dealer in North America.
Provides maps and navigation directions. Includes street maps, current traffic, satellite maps and more.
Find the Pilot Travel Centers and Flying J locations in your area.
Map out your daily route to include TA or Petro locations wherever you go.
Calculates vehicle weights for both axle and platform scales quickly and easily.

Provides immediate connectivity to Daimler Trucks’ network of locations including Freightliner, Sterling, Western Star and Thomas Built Buses dealers, Detroit Diesel distributors and TravelCenters of America and Petro.
Live truck routing with the latest truck-specific maps and routes.
Helps you find your nearest Volvo Trucks Dealer in North America.
Find free or paid public Wi-Fi hotspots while online or offline.
Google Play Store is not installed on this device.
Please wait while DashLink is updated…

Can’t change duty status while DashLink equipped vehicle is moving.
Can’t edit duty status events while DashLink equipped vehicle is moving.
This day contains driving time that was automatically recorded by DashLink and can’t be edited.
Your vehicle is in motion. Change duty status to Driving?
Your vehicle is in motion. Change duty status to Off Duty Driving?
Your vehicle has stopped. Change duty status to On Duty Not Driving?
Your vehicle has stopped. Change duty status to Off Duty?
More driving was done than is allowed by a yard move so the duty status was changed to Driving.
You can move a short distance before your duty status will change to Driving.\n\nRemaining: %s
Please wait 5 minutes before starting your next yard move.
Off duty drive time is automatically recorded
Yard move time is automatically recorded
I declare that all vehicles shown above have been inspected in accordance with the applicable requirements.
Do you want to delete this DVIR and all associated inspections?
After saving or deleting this DVIR you will be taken to the next item with warnings.
Do you want to delete this inspection?
After saving or deleting this inspection you will be taken to the next item with warnings.
Please provide a vehicle number for this inspection.
There are currently no photos attached.\n\nTap the camera icon to take pictures of your document’s pages. Tap the film roll to attach previously saved photos.
You must attach a photo or enter a note before you send the document.
Documents are always sent to your fleet.
Please add at least one email address to send your document.
To sign your log you must enter your name and email address and record a signature.
The email address “%s” is already in use. If it belongs to you, use it to sign in to the app.
Your email address was changed to “%s”
Please enter your email address before setting a password.
The email address “%s” is not valid. Please correct it and try again.
Please enter your first and last names.
Name, email address, password, time zone, duty cycle, etc.
No matching email address found.\n\nPress the “Add New” button to add this email address.
The email address provided is not valid. Email addresses usually look like “name@company.com”.
By using this app I agree to be bound by the Terms of Service agreement.
You can access the agreement at any time at http://www.bigroad.com/terms-of-service
Please check the box indicating you have read and agreed to the terms of service agreement before pressing Accept.
24-hour cycle reset for oilfield operations, ground water drilling, construction materials and equipment §395.1 (d)(1), (l), (m)
The 16 hour big day exception can only be used by U.S. interstate property carrying vehicles.
Tank vehicle with a capacity of more than 500 gallons transporting flammable liquid
The California farm products cycle can only be used with property carrying vehicles.
The California motion picture exception can only be used with property carrying vehicles.
30-minute break exempt under a current state or federal waiver (e.g. livestock haulers)
Oilfield specialists using the oilfield waiting time exception are not eligible for short-haul operations.
You have selected the Texas intrastate cycle and the 100 air-mile short-haul exception, which does not apply in Texas.\n\nDo you want to use the Texas 150 air-mile exception?
You may only select a maximum of one short-haul exception.
Cycle restarted after being off-duty from %1$s at %2$s until %3$s at %4$s.
How many days of logs do you wish to present for inspection?
No vehicle inspections today. Go to a specific log day to add a vehicle inspection.
There is one day with validation warnings.
Pick number of days to inspect
If you enjoy using %@, would you mind taking a moment to rate it? It won’t take more than a minute. Thanks for your support!
Press the Install button to download this application from Google Play and add it to the BigRoad toolbar.
Set which view should be displayed when driving
You must sign in to another fleet to view the selected message.
This report already contains other truck inspections. Do you want to use the existing report or create a new report for %1$s?
Please provide a carrier name for this inspection report.
Please provide an inspector name for this inspection report.
DashLink will be used with this vehicle.
Please provide an identification number for this truck.
Tap to upgrade your BigRoad app!
Truck %s cannot be used until you have connected to the internet.
Without allowing BigRoad to use your camera, you won’t be able to take pictures of documents. To enable this, please grant the Camera permission to BigRoad under the phones Settings menu.

Without allowing BigRoad to access your contacts, you will have to manually enter contacts to share logs and check-ins. To enable this, please grant the Contacts permission to BigRoad under the phones Settings menu.

Without allowing BigRoad to use your GPS, we won’t be able to automatically fill in your duty status location. To enable this, please grant the Location permissions to BigRoad under the phones Settings menu.
We use your camera to take pictures of documents to send to your dispatch team.
We use your contacts to simplify sending logs and check-ins.
We use your device’s GPS to help you fill out your duty status location.
Carrier: This is a long carrier name
Note: This is a note. A long note. That should probably wrap in some layouts or something.
Home time zone: USA: Eastern Time
Validation error something is wrong and should be fixed.
Driving after 11 hours of accumulated driving time since start of shift
There was a problem printing your daily log. Please check your printer and try again.
There was a problem preparing your document for printing. Please make sure your phone has a working network connection and try again.

BigRoad needs to collect a list of installed applications and contact details from your device in order for certain features to work, such as the quick access toolbar and the emailing/printing of logs.\n\nData collection can be enabled and disabled in the settings section of the application.
Allow collection of application data and contact data
Thank you for using BigRoad!\nPlease take a moment to rate it.
Take a moment to rate BigRoad
(Recap table is shown on the log)
Available hours for tomorrow will be shown after today’s log has been completed.
You have chosen to reject carrier edit requests on your log. Please give a reason to confirm your rejection.
You may only drive truck %s for personal conveyance while off duty if:
You are not working (e.g. carrying a load, fueling, repositioning)
AND you are driving to/from a personal destination (e.g. home, hotel, restaurant)
Do you want to remove “%s” from this message?
You have started driving but have not picked which truck you are driving.
No matching truck found.\n\nPress the “Add” button to add this truck.
Adjustments to the odometer of a DashLink-equipped truck will be recorded on the trip sheet.
Please provide an odometer value for this truck
Check out BigRoad, the best FREE app for truck drivers. Get it at http://get.bigroad.com\nBigRoad keeps you connected, compliant and making more money!
I’m using the BigRoad trucker app for Android and iOS! Get it FREE at http://get.bigroad.com
I’m using the BigRoad trucker app for Android and iOS! Get it FREE at http://get.bigroad.com
Check that you entered it correctly. (Did you forget it?)
Check that you entered it correctly. (Did you sign up?)
Please enter an email address to sign in.
Your new password was emailed to %s
If you’ve forgotten your password, we can create a new one and email it to you. Would you like to reset your password?
Do you want to go off duty before signing out?
That email address is already in use. Please sign up using a different address to keep your current logs.
Signing out now will delete any logs or other information permanently.
Create your free account now to keep your logs.
You have not created an account yet. If you sign out now, you will lose all of the driver logs you have created.
That email address is already in use. If it belongs to you, use it to sign in to the app.
Password must be at least 6 characters
Please check the box to agree before continuing.
We’ll keep a record of your driver logs so you can always find them, even if you lose or break your phone.
This truck has %s of unassigned driving events logged since your last connection to DashLink.
You have %1$d unassigned driving events logged on this day
You have 1 unassigned driving event logged on this day
Truck %1$s has been driven for %2$s without an assigned driver.
Warning: The new odometer is lower than the previous odometer.
This truck is a DashLink equipped truck.
Missing odometer reading for DashLink-equipped truck
Day has less than %1$s hours of total off-duty time
Day has less than %1$s hours of total off-duty time in blocks of at least 30 minutes each
Day has less than %1$s hours of total off-duty time in blocks of at least 30 minutes each, where at most 8 of the required 10 hours can come from an off-duty period that is used as a shift reset
Driving after %1$s hours of accumulated driving time since start of shift
Driving after %1$s hours since start of shift
Driving after %1$s hours of accumulated driving time today

Driver, vehicle, fleet & shipping information not yet added.

By creating an account, you will be able to access your logs from any device. This means if this device is lost or stolen, you will still be able to access all of your BigRoad data.
